results.title: Werribee: in harmony with nature
results.creator_credit: Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works and Filmpartnership
results.brief_description: Deals with the disposal of Melbourne’s sewage through the land sewerage scheme at Werribee farm which involves natural purification and recycling.

results.title: Capricorn charter
results.creator_credit: Frank Killian, Queensland Government Tourist Bureau and Movietone Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the tourist features of the central coast of Queensland, with scenes around Rockhampton, Heron, Great Keppel and Quoin Islands, Yeppoon, Emu Park, Gladstone, Emerald and the Mount Morgan Mines.

results.title: Trapper Murphy
results.creator_credit: Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Describes the menace to sheep of dingoes and foxes in the Bogong High Plains in Victoria and shows something of the way in which they are being exterminated. Includes a shot of dingoes actually killing sheep at night.

Please be advised: this film includes scenes of animals being hunted and destroyed which may be distressing to viewers.

results.title: Water for life and living
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Cine Service Productions
results.brief_description: The recreational facilities established by the Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works around its reservoirs through its beautification program provide ideal surroundings for picnickers and the film shows the attraction provided, as well as some stages of construction of the Cardinia Reservoir. Narrated by Geoff Raymond.

results.title: [Melbourne newsreel: 1925]
results.brief_description: A newsreel of Melbourne in 1925 containing scenes of Empire Day celebrations at Princes Hill State School, Carlton; the opening of the Melbourne Track Season; a three-mile handicap race at Caulfield Racecourse by the Combined Harriers; and long-distance running. Re-released in 1947 by the National Film Archive.
results.description: A newsreel of Melbourne in 1925 containing scenes of Empire Day celebrations at Princes Hill State School, Carlton; the opening of the Melbourne Track Season; a three-mile handicap race at Caulfield Racecourse by the Combined Harriers; and long-distance running. results.title: For the love of a child
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stanley and Nomad Films International
results.brief_description: This film explores and examines natural childbirth and how it is being accepted. The film shows a Childbirth Education Class at work. These classes are teaching women to understand and control what is happening to their bodies during childbirth, and it involves fathers to be.
results.description: This film explores and examines natural childbirth and how it is being accepted. The film shows a Childbirth Education Class at work. These classes are teaching women to understand and control what is happening to their bodies during childbirth, and it involves fathers to be.

results.title: Focus on Ageing (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A recording of a discussion panel at Rusden State College with four active elderly people. Issues discussed included the structuring of time, community involvement, adjustment to retirement homes, attitudes to death and the art of ageing

results.title: Tucker
results.brief_description: Highlights the importance of good food habits. The importance of early experiences is emphasized, together with the valuable role of the school canteen and the teachers who promote good eating habits using the basic five food groups.

results.title: Frame looms
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson, John Gray and Educational Media Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Weaving”.
A simple instructional film on weaving for both beginners and more advanced weavers. Attractive woven patterns can be made on any type of frame.

results.title: Horses
results.brief_description: Two girls go cross-country-hacking. The film explains preparation, brushing, bridling, and saddling. Good introductory film to beginners and non-riders.
